meta.notes: Gold target plans for Study C. Linked cases extracted from OpenR1-Psy; unlinked cases generated from patient_summary + critical_entities.

c_001.plan: Therapy: suggesting exploring thoughts and behaviors

c_002.plan: Therapy: CBT techniques to challenge their thoughts

c_003.plan: Therapy: support their process without labeling it as a clinical issue since they don't mention hopelessness or worthlessness

c_004.plan: Therapy: suggest grounding techniques, like deep breathing, which can help in the moment

c_005.plan: Therapy: supportively help them see the discrepancy between past criticism and their actual skills, as evidenced by the recent praise

c_006.plan: Therapy: CBT techniques, but frame them as practical steps

c_007.plan: Therapy: suggest reflecting on what other interpretations might exist, and how each affects their feelings

c_008.plan: Therapy: support without using clinical terms

c_010.plan: Therapy: suggest a way to process these emotions

c_011.plan: Therapy: motivational interviewing and relapse prevention. Medication: naltrexone or acamprosate; disulfiram if appropriate. Skills: trigger identification, coping strategies, and support group attendance. Follow-up: abstinence tracking, liver function, and craving intensity

c_012.plan: Therapy: pain management program with CBT for chronic pain. Medication: antidepressant with pain benefits (e.g., duloxetine, amitriptyline). Skills: pacing, activity scheduling, and cognitive coping for pain. Follow-up: pain levels, functional status, and mood

c_013.plan: Therapy: family-based therapy (FBT) or CBT-E for eating disorders. Medication: limited role; address comorbid depression/anxiety. Skills: meal planning, body image work, and cognitive flexibility. Follow-up: weight restoration, vital signs, and electrolytes

c_014.plan: Therapy: pain management program with CBT for chronic pain. Medication: antidepressant with pain benefits (e.g., duloxetine, amitriptyline). Skills: pacing, activity scheduling, and cognitive coping for pain. Follow-up: pain levels, functional status, and mood

c_015.plan: Therapy: CBT or interpersonal therapy for depression. Medication: SSRI antidepressant (e.g., sertraline) with monitoring. Skills: behavioral activation, mood tracking, and sleep hygiene. Follow-up: suicidal ideation screening and PHQ-9 tracking

c_016.plan: Therapy: CBT adapted for older adults; reminiscence therapy. Medication: SSRI with attention to drug interactions and side effects. Skills: behavioral activation, social engagement, and meaningful activity. Follow-up: depression severity, cognitive status, and medical comorbidities

c_017.plan: Therapy: CBTp (CBT for psychosis) and family intervention. Medication: Continue/monitor psychosis (stable, on medication); antipsychotic medication with metabolic monitoring. Skills: reality testing, early warning sign recognition, and social skills. Follow-up: positive/negative symptoms, medication side effects

c_018.plan: Therapy: stress management and supportive counseling. Medication: antidepressant if depression develops. Skills: respite planning, boundary setting, and self-care scheduling. Follow-up: burnout symptoms, depression screening, and respite utilization

c_019.plan: Therapy: CBT for health anxiety and somatic symptoms. Medication: low-dose antidepressant for symptom management. Skills: attention shifting, activity pacing, and medical reassurance reduction. Follow-up: healthcare utilization and symptom distress

c_020.plan: Therapy: CBTp and family intervention; vocational rehabilitation. Medication: antipsychotic with metabolic monitoring. Skills: early warning signs, medication adherence, and social engagement. Follow-up: symptom severity, side effects, and functional goals

c_021.plan: Therapy: phase-oriented trauma therapy with grounding focus. Medication: address comorbid PTSD/depression. Skills: grounding techniques, safety signals, and containment strategies. Follow-up: dissociation frequency and trauma processing progress

c_022.plan: Therapy: CBT adapted for older adults; relaxation training. Medication: SSRI with careful titration; avoid benzodiazepines. Skills: worry management, relaxation, and cognitive restructuring. Follow-up: anxiety severity, fall risk, and cognitive function

c_023.plan: Therapy: CBT with mirror exposure and response prevention. Medication: SSRI at higher doses (similar to OCD). Skills: reducing checking/camouflaging, cognitive restructuring. Follow-up: BDD severity and insight level

c_024.plan: Therapy: stress management and work-life balance counseling. Medication: antidepressant if depression develops. Skills: boundary setting, recovery activities, and values clarification. Follow-up: burnout dimensions, sleep, and return-to-work planning

c_025.plan: Therapy: CBT or interpersonal therapy adapted for perinatal period. Medication: SSRI with consideration of breastfeeding safety. Skills: infant attachment support, partner involvement, and self-care. Follow-up: mood, bonding concerns, and infant safety
